# What is R-Ladies? {.smaller}

-   R-Ladies is a world-wide organization with the mission of promoting **gender diversity in the R community**

-   Started in San Francisco in 2012 and now has **225 chapters** globally (check out [rladies.org](https://rladies.org/) for more information)

-   R-Ladies is rebranding to `R-Ladies+` in order to be more inclusive of all underrepresented genders in the R community. You can read more about this transition [here](https://rladies.org/news/rebranding-rladies/).

# About today's speaker

- Bobbi Carothers is a senior data analyst at the WashU School of Public Health. 
- She was one of the R experts at the very first R-Ladies St. Louis Meetup in 2017.
- Her work includes development of online survey tools, analysis, as well as report and paper development. 
- Prior projects have included evaluations for the local, regional, state, and national health organizations.
